data:
Facsimile Images

Πανχάρεός εἰμι
καὶ το͂ν φίλο̄ν ϙοινά εἰμι

Apparatus criticus

Text after Arena 1989 (IGASM I) ; Orlandini, Jeffery, Dubois: Παντάρεος ; Lazzarini: Πανχάρεος ; Arena 1989: the iota of καὶ was initially omitted and was added in a later stage.

English translation

I am (the cup) of Panchares, and I am shared among (his) friends.

Italian translation

Sono (la coppa) di Panchares, e sono condivisa tra i (suoi) amici.

commentary

The inscription is written, according to Arena (1986) in the Megarian alphabet but was found in Gela. According to Jeffery (1961) the object may have ended up in Gela following the events that caused the conquest of Megara by Syracuse. It should be noted that the name Πανχάρες is recurrent in Megara Nisea, as Arena (1989) points out reporting parallels with IG VII 1-11, 12, 13, 42 and IG IV 926 (= IG IV 1[2] 71), and occurrs once in Akraiphia, Boeotia (IG VII 2750). The text, which denounces the name of its possessor, refers to its use during symposia.

bibliography

    Panvini 1993 154, III.32 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10002502 Arena 1989 10, pl.4.2 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10000638 Dubois 1989 147 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10000187 Arena 1986 181ff., pl.12a https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10002661 Lazzarini 1984 408 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10001885 Jeffery 1990 278 no.50 pl.53 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10000678 Jeffery 1961 278 no.50 pl.53 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10000677 Orlandini 1956 144ff., pl.60.4 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10001718
